segments.translation: 너무 심심해서 재단 규정까지 읽고 있었어. 비행 매뉴얼도 이렇게까지 내 관심을 끌지는 못했는데 말이야.

segments.text: She waves at her and leaves without looking back.
segments.translation: 그녀는 손을 흔들더니 뒤돌아보지도 않고 가버렸다.

segments.text: So long, Sonetto. Hopefully there is good news for us next time I see you.
segments.speaker: Lilya
segments.translation: 그럼 안녕, 소네트. 다음에 만날 때는 좋은 소식이 있기를 바라.

segments.text: We are falling behind even further. A vote or two won't help us turn this around ...
segments.speaker: Delegate
segments.translation: 우리는 더욱 뒤처지고 있습니다. 한두 표로는 이 상황을 뒤바꿀 수 없어요...

segments.text: I know.
segments.speaker: Z
segments.translation: 알고 있어.

segments.text: The move to D9 was indeed useless.
segments.speaker: Z
segments.translation: D9로의 이동은 정말 무의미했군.

segments.text: The arcanists that were on our side have defected.
segments.speaker: Delegate
segments.translation: 우리 편이었던 마도술사들이 배신했어.

segments.text: I misjudged the situation in the debate ...
segments.speaker: Delegate
segments.translation: 토론에서 상황을 잘못 판단했군...

segments.text: I was going to seize the opportunity ... and the initiative ...
segments.speaker: Delegate
segments.translation: 기회를... 그리고 주도권을 잡으려고 했는데...

segments.text: She doesn't respond to him, only pacing back and forth in the room.
segments.translation: 그녀는 그에게 대답하지 않고 방 안을 이리저리 서성거릴 뿐이었다.

segments.text: To seize the initiative ...
segments.speaker: Z
segments.translation: 적극적으로 공격한다라...

segments.text: ... may bring us the chance.
segments.speaker: Z
segments.translation: ...기회를 가져다줄지도 몰라.

segments.text: Thirty-eight lines go across the board in horizontal and vertical directions, crossing one another in 361 intersections as orderly as the stars.
segments.translation: 서른여덟 개의 선이 가로세로 방향으로 바둑판을 가로지르며, 별자리처럼 질서정연하게 361개의 교차점에서 만난다.

segments.text: That is to say, don't pull back, don't jump ... even when they're attacking ...
segments.speaker: Z
segments.translation: 바꿔 말하자면, 상대방이 공격했을 때 물러서거나 달아나지 않는 대신...

segments.text: But to focus on the bigger picture, to win strong positions ...
segments.speaker: Z
segments.translation: 하지만 더 큰 그림을 보고, 유리한 위치를 선점하려면...

segments.text: She seems to have a sudden flash of insights, and reaches out one of her hands without being aware of doing so.
segments.translation: 그녀는 갑자기 영감이 떠오른 듯했고, 자신도 모르게 한 손을 뻗었다.

segments.text: The Black ... tsuke.
segments.speaker: Z
segments.translation: 흑돌, 붙이기.

segments.text: Then ... the White hane. And the Black counter hane here. The White stand, the Black ...
segments.speaker: Z
segments.translation: 그럼... 백의 하네. 그리고 여기 흑의 응수 하네. 백의 서기, 흑의...

segments.text: Osae.
segments.speaker: Z
segments.translation: 오사에.

segments.text: Through these moves ... I see.
segments.speaker: Z
segments.translation: 이런 식이라면... 알겠어.

segments.text: The move to D11 can save us more than ten moku of stones.
segments.speaker: Z
segments.translation: D11의 돌은 이곳의 열 몇 집을 되찾을 수 있어.

segments.text: We can still win within ten moves.
segments.speaker: Z
segments.translation: 열 수 내에서 우린 아직 승산이 있어.

segments.text: Mark.
segments.speaker: Z
segments.translation: 마크.

segments.text: Yes? Are there any other things we can do?
segments.speaker: Delegate
segments.translation: 네? 저희가 할 수 있는 다른 일이 또 있나요?

segments.text: We need an influencer. A leader who can win us more than ten votes.
segments.speaker: Z
segments.translation: 우리에겐 영향력 있는 사람이 필요해, 말로 열 사람 넘게 움직일 수 있는 지도자 말이야.

segments.text: Get me the files of the uncommitted leaders, including those who weren't neutral about this issue in the beginning.
segments.speaker: Z
segments.translation: 아직 입장을 정하지 않은 지도자들의 파일을 가져와. 처음에 이 문제에 대해 중립적이지 않았던 자들도 포함해서 말이야.

segments.text: ... Okay.
segments.speaker: Delegate
segments.translation: ... 알겠습니다.

segments.text: He seems perplexed, but still quickly retrieves the files and starts browsing them on the chair.
segments.translation: 그는 당황한 듯했지만, 여전히 재빨리 파일들을 가져와서 의자에 앉아 훑어보기 시작했다.

segments.text: The room is in complete silence except for the slight noise of flipping pages.
segments.translation: 방 안에는 책장을 넘기는 소리만 들렸다.

segments.text: Barzel.
segments.speaker: Delegate
segments.translation: 바르젤.

segments.text: No. Too young to be convincing.
segments.speaker: Z
segments.translation: 안 돼, 아직 경력이 적어서 대중을 설득하기 어려워.

segments.text: Nonie, head of the Natural Resource Committee.
segments.speaker: Delegate
segments.translation: 천연자원위원회 위원장 노니입니다.

segments.text: There are only three of them in the group.
segments.speaker: Z
segments.translation: 거긴 세 사람뿐이잖아.

segments.text: "Center" Bernard, leader of the Mankind Caucus ... Ugh, forget it.
segments.speaker: Delegate
segments.translation: 「센터」 버나드, 인류 코커스의 리더... 아, 됐어.

segments.text: Bernard?
segments.speaker: Z
segments.translation: 버나드?

segments.text: Yes, he can be our man. He is eloquent and leads a group of 11. All of the 11 are his loyal followers.
segments.speaker: Z
segments.translation: 그래, 그 사람을 우리 편으로 만들 수 있을 거야. 말솜씨도 좋고 11명으로 구성된 그룹을 이끌고 있어. 그 11명 모두 그에게 충성하는 추종자들이지.

segments.text: Why is he uncommitted? I thought he would be the first to vote.
segments.speaker: Z
segments.translation: 어째서 아직 입장을 안 밝힌 거지? 제일 먼저 투표할 줄 알았는데.

segments.text: Perhaps they believe it's a sure bet ...
segments.speaker: Delegate
segments.translation: 아마 그들은 이건 확실한 승부라고 생각하는 모양이군...

segments.text: Find out what he's been up to.
segments.speaker: Z
segments.translation: 이 자의 근황에 대해 알아봐.

segments.text: But Madam Z, are you sure you want to cooperate with him? This doesn't make any sense. We don't even serve the same group.
segments.speaker: Delegate
segments.translation: 하지만 Z 여사님, 정말로 그와 협력하실 건가요? 이해가 안 됩니다. 우리는 같은 조직에 소속되어 있지도 않잖아요.

segments.text: Mark, we are all serving for the Foundation's future.
segments.speaker: Z
segments.translation: 마크, 우린 다들 재단의 미래를 위해 일하는 거야.

segments.text: I just want to know what he needs now.
segments.speaker: Z
segments.translation: 그저 지금 그에게 뭐가 필요한지 알고 싶을 뿐이고.

segments.text: The office in Chicago, U.S.
segments.speaker: Delegate
segments.translation: 미국 시카고에 있는 사무소입니다.

segments.text: He is trying to cover that region with his influence.
segments.speaker: Delegate
segments.translation: 그는 자신의 영향력으로 그 지역을 장악하려고 하고 있어.

segments.text: Bernard believes the employees there are guilty of serious dereliction of duty: they discriminate against humans of different classes and are suspected of committing electoral fraud in collusion with the local capitals.
segments.speaker: Delegate
segments.translation: 베르나르는 그곳 직원들이 심각한 직무유기를 저질렀다고 생각해. 계급이 다른 인간들을 차별하고, 지역 자본가들과 결탁해서 선거 부정을 저질렀다는 의혹을 받고 있거든.

segments.text: The Supreme Court's investigators have already intervened.
segments.speaker: Delegate
segments.translation: 대법원 조사원들이 이미 개입했어.

segments.text: But they cannot go out due to the "Storm" right now ... so the case is pending investigation.
segments.speaker: Delegate
segments.translation: 하지만 지금은 폭풍우 때문에 외출할 수 없어서... 사건 조사가 보류된 상태입니다.

segments.text: Chicago office ... I've read the reports on there ...
segments.speaker: Z
segments.translation: 시카고 사무소... 그곳의 보고서를 본 적 있어...

segments.text: I see.
segments.speaker: Z
segments.translation: 알겠습니다.

segments.text: Great. Exactly what we can help with.
segments.speaker: Z
segments.translation: 좋아. 바로 우리가 도울 수 있는 일이군.

segments.text: Through what?
segments.speaker: Delegate
segments.translation: 뭘 통해서?

segments.text: Through Sonetto.
segments.speaker: Z
segments.translation: 소네트를 통해서.

segments.text: I have a meeting with her on Friday ...
segments.speaker: Z
segments.translation: 금요일에 그녀와 회의가 있어...

segments.text: This may lead us to a win-win situation.
segments.speaker: Z
segments.translation: 이렇게 하면 서로 윈윈하는 상황을 만들 수 있을 거야.

segments.text: Best wishes for the upcoming victory!
segments.speaker: Follower I
segments.translation: 다가올 승리를 위해 행운을 빕니다!

segments.text: It will be the final vote soon. It's a stunning victory for us ... Cheers!
segments.speaker: Follower II
segments.translation: 곧 최종 투표가 있을 거야. 우리의 압도적인 승리다... 건배!

segments.text: Cheers! May the peace be with us!
segments.speaker: Bernard
segments.translation: 건배! 우리에게 평화가 함께하길!

segments.text: The group is fully immersed in the joy brought by the collective glory.
segments.translation: 일행은 집단의 영광이 가져다준 기쁨에 완전히 빠져들었다.

segments.text: You're in a good mood.
segments.speaker: Z
segments.translation: 기분이 좋아 보이는군.

segments.text: Z?
segments.speaker: Bernard
segments.translation: Z?

segments.text: You must be in the wrong room.
segments.speaker: Follower II
segments.translation: 방을 잘못 찾아오신 것 같은데요.

segments.text: You can't find those friends who tell balderdash here.
segments.speaker: Follower II
segments.translation: 여기서는 헛소리나 지껄이는 친구들을 찾을 수 없을 거야.

segments.text: Bernard stops them with a wag of a hand. He pushes his way through the crowd and comes up to her.
segments.translation: 베르나르가 손을 흔들어 그들을 제지했다. 그는 군중을 헤치고 나아가 그녀에게 다가왔다.

segments.text: What brings you here, our honorable committee member?
segments.speaker: Bernard
segments.translation: 무슨 일로 이곳에 오셨나요, 존경하는 위원회 위원님?

segments.text: May I have a word with you, Bernard?
segments.speaker: Z
segments.translation: 잠깐 얘기 좀 하지, 버나드.

segments.text: Let me check my watch again. Hmm, it's three in the afternoon. I don't think I've drunk that much.
segments.speaker: Bernard
segments.translation: 시계를 다시 한 번 확인해보자. 음, 오후 3시네. 그렇게 많이 마신 것 같지는 않은데.

segments.text: Could you repeat that again?
segments.speaker: Bernard
segments.translation: 다시 한 번 말해줄 수 있어?

segments.text: You want me, to canvass, for you?
segments.speaker: Bernard
segments.translation: 당신을 위해 제가 표를 모으러 다니라고요?

segments.text: To be more precise, to form a partnership.
segments.speaker: Z
segments.translation: 정확히 말하자면 협력 관계를 맺자는 거지.

segments.text: My my, what a creative idea.
segments.speaker: Bernard
segments.translation: 오호, 정말 창의적인 아이디어군.

segments.text: What can you offer?
segments.speaker: Bernard
segments.translation: 뭘 줄 수 있는데?

segments.text: Not supporting such a stupid draft next time?
segments.speaker: Bernard
segments.translation: 다음엔 그런 바보 같은 초안 지지 안 할 거지?

segments.text: Or recruiting new arcanists for our caucus?
segments.speaker: Bernard
segments.translation: 아니면 우리 모임에 새로운 마도사들을 영입하는 건가?

segments.text: What about a witness for the case of Chicago office?
segments.speaker: Z
segments.translation: 시카고 사무소 사건의 증인은 어떻게 할 건가?

segments.text: He instantly frowns.
segments.translation: 그 순간 그의 미간이 찌푸려졌다.

segments.text: Who is it? Give me the name.
segments.speaker: Bernard
segments.translation: 누구야? 이름을 말해.

segments.text: I will if you collaborate with me.
segments.speaker: Z
segments.translation: 자네가 나와 협력한다면 그러도록 하지.

segments.text: Or talk to me with a better attitude.
segments.speaker: Z
segments.translation: 더 우호적인 태도로 대화한다면 그러도록 하지.

segments.text: ... I'm sorry.
segments.speaker: Bernard
segments.translation: ... 미안해.

segments.text: Our philosophies have always been different, and that led to prejudice.
segments.speaker: Bernard
segments.translation: 우리의 철학은 항상 달랐고, 그것이 편견으로 이어졌지.

segments.text: But being mysterious won't show us sincerity for each other, right?
segments.speaker: Bernard
segments.translation: 하지만 신비주의적으로 굴면 서로에 대한 진심을 보여줄 수 없잖아, 그렇지?

segments.text: A staff of mine is willing to testify as a witness. Her report can prove your point.
segments.speaker: Z
segments.translation: 내 부하 중 한 명이 증인으로 출석하려 하네. 당신의 관점을 증명할 수 있는 보고서를 작성했지.

segments.text: Strong enough to prove their negligence?
segments.speaker: Bernard
segments.translation: 그들의 과실을 증명할 만큼 확실한 증거야?

segments.text: It depends on the special prosecutor.
segments.speaker: Z
segments.translation: 글쎄, 그건 특별검사가 어떻게 생각하는지에 달렸겠지.

segments.text: But the evidence is strong enough to prove that you're innocent from setting up others out of your personal interest.
segments.speaker: Z
segments.translation: 하지만 증거만으로도 자네가 개인적인 이익을 위해 다른 사람들을 함정에 빠뜨리지 않았다는 걸 증명하기엔 충분해.

segments.text: He can't help breaking into laughter.
segments.translation: 그는 웃음을 참을 수 없었다.

segments.text: Looks like you've got your own little bird.
segments.speaker: Bernard
segments.translation: 자네도 작은 새 한 마리를 얻었군.

segments.text: The management there sucks. They don't serve humans or arcanists. They are just puppets manipulated by money.
segments.speaker: Bernard
segments.translation: 거기 경영진들은 정말 최악이야. 인간이든 마도사든 상관없이 제대로 대우해주지 않아. 그냥 돈에 놀아나는 꼭두각시들일 뿐이지.

segments.text: I wanna bring order back to that place.
segments.speaker: Bernard
segments.translation: 그곳에 다시 질서를 되찾고 싶어.

segments.text: And I've collected quite a lot of evidence against them.
segments.speaker: Bernard
segments.translation: 그리고 그들에 대한 증거도 꽤 많이 수집했어.

segments.text: Yet the most ridiculous thing happened: in the second week after I submitted the investigation application to the Supreme Court ...
segments.speaker: Bernard
segments.translation: 하지만 가장 우스꽝스러운 일이 벌어졌지. 대법원에 조사 신청서를 제출한 지 두 번째 주에...

segments.text: The evidence was gone.
segments.speaker: Bernard
segments.translation: 증거가 사라졌어.

segments.text: My men found their charred pieces in the garbage room ... Someone threw them into the shredding incinerator.
segments.speaker: Bernard
segments.translation: 내 부하들이 쓰레기 처리실에서 그것들의 탄 조각들을 발견했어... 누군가 그것들을 파쇄 소각로에 던져 넣었던 거야.

segments.text: It was like I could do nothing but surrender.
segments.speaker: Bernard
segments.translation: 마치 항복하는 것 외에는 아무것도 할 수 없는 것 같았어.

segments.text: You have a wolf by your ears ... I understand.
segments.speaker: Z
segments.translation: 중간에 손을 뗄 수도 없었겠지... 이해해.

segments.text: Bernard takes a deep breath before he starts to talk again.
segments.translation: 베르나르가 다시 말을 시작하기 전에 깊게 숨을 들이쉬었다.

segments.text: But you're asking for too much.
segments.speaker: Bernard
segments.translation: 하지만 너무 많은 걸 요구하고 있어.

segments.text: Eleven votes? We're on the opposite side. I can never persuade all of them to vote for you.
segments.speaker: Bernard
segments.translation: 11표? 우리는 반대편에 있어. 그들 모두를 설득해서 당신에게 투표하게 만드는 건 불가능해.

segments.text: Besides, the court session of the Chicago case starts later than the final vote ...
segments.speaker: Bernard
segments.translation: 게다가 시카고 사건의 법정 심리는 최종 투표보다 늦게 시작되는데...

segments.text: Don't tell me you want the service before you pay for it.
segments.speaker: Bernard
segments.translation: 설마 돈도 안 내고 서비스부터 받으려는 건 아니겠지?

segments.text: Don't worry. You can vote after testifying.
segments.speaker: Z
segments.translation: 걱정 마, 자넨 증언한 뒤에 투표할 수 있을 거야.

segments.text: How are you gonna do that?
segments.speaker: Bernard
segments.translation: 그걸 어떻게 할 건데?

segments.text: I will do what I can, in my power.
segments.speaker: Z
segments.translation: 내 신분으로 가능한 것들을 해봐야지.

segments.text: The vote won't start so soon.
segments.speaker: Z
segments.translation: 투표 표결이 그렇게 빨리 시작되진 않을 거야.

segments.text: He raises one eyebrow.
segments.translation: 그가 한쪽 눈썹을 치켜올렸다.

segments.text: I can try for nine votes ... or ten.
segments.speaker: Bernard
segments.translation: 9표... 아니면 10표 정도는 노려볼 수 있을 것 같은데.

segments.text: For the appreciation of your political resourcefulness.
segments.speaker: Bernard
segments.translation: 당신의 정치적 수완에 대한 감사의 표시로.

segments.text: Madam Z holds the hand waiting in front of her.
segments.translation: Z 부인이 앞에서 기다리고 있는 손을 잡았다.

segments.text: Good luck making a better Chicago office, Bernard.
segments.speaker: Z
segments.translation: 시카고 사무소에 좋은 변화를 가져다주길 바라네, 버나드.

segments.text: Unlike the other days, Constantine isn't by her desk today.
segments.translation: 콘스탄틴은 전과 달리 사무실 책상 옆에 앉아 있지 않았다.

segments.text: The light in the room stays off.
segments.translation: 방에는 불이 켜지지 않았다.

segments.text: She has her back to the door, facing the window. Daylight slowly permeates into the dark room through the rigid marble windows.
segments.translation: 그녀는 문에 등을 돌린 채 창문을 바라보고 있었다. 딱딱한 대리석 창문 사이로 낮의 빛이 어두운 방 안으로 천천히 스며들었다.

segments.text: It's Pedra.
segments.speaker: Committee Member Ⅰ
segments.translation: 페드라야.

segments.text: Come in.
segments.speaker: Constantine
segments.translation: 들어와.

segments.text: I'm here to report the situation so far.
segments.speaker: Committee Member Ⅰ
segments.translation: 지금까지의 상황을 보고하러 왔습니다.

segments.text: Some neutral parties have tilted in favor of the draft.
segments.speaker: Committee Member Ⅰ
segments.translation: 일부 중립 세력들이 초안 쪽으로 기울고 있습니다.

segments.text: How many?
segments.speaker: Constantine
segments.translation: 몇 명이나?

segments.text: Not a lot of them, but enough to make the votes even.
segments.speaker: Committee Member Ⅰ
segments.translation: 수는 많지 않지만, 표를 동점으로 만들기엔 충분해.

segments.text: They have always pursued revolution in the Foundation. Looks like Mark has finally persuaded them.
segments.speaker: Committee Member Ⅰ
segments.translation: 그들은 항상 재단에서 혁명을 추구해왔지. 마크가 드디어 그들을 설득한 것 같군.

segments.text: I heard Ms. Z has been working hard on canvassing, too.
segments.speaker: Committee Member Ⅰ
segments.translation: Z 씨도 표심 공략에 열심히 매진하고 있다고 들었습니다.

segments.text: But the number of the conservatives remains the same. We don't have to worry about that.
segments.speaker: Committee Member Ⅰ
segments.translation: 하지만 보수파의 수는 그대로야. 그건 걱정할 필요 없어.

segments.text: I believe we will still prevail in the final vote days later.
segments.speaker: Committee Member Ⅰ
segments.translation: 며칠 후 최종 투표에서도 우리가 승리할 것이라고 믿습니다.

segments.text: What about the other groups?
segments.speaker: Constantine
segments.translation: 다른 그룹들은 어떻게 됐어?

segments.text: Still functioning as usual, nothing special.
segments.speaker: Committee Member Ⅰ
segments.translation: 평소와 다름없이 정상 작동 중입니다. 특별한 건 없고요.

segments.text: By the way, Bernard and his men paid a visit to SPDM. I didn't get to talk to them.
segments.speaker: Committee Member Ⅰ
segments.translation: 그런데 베르나르와 그의 부하들이 SPDM에 들렀더군. 나는 그들과 대화할 기회가 없었어.

segments.text: She turns back to face the window.
segments.translation: 그녀가 다시 창문 쪽으로 몸을 돌렸다.

segments.text: Thank you for the report.
segments.speaker: Constantine
segments.translation: 보고 고마워.

segments.text: She has never been so persistent.
segments.speaker: Constantine
segments.translation: 저 애가 저렇게 끈질긴 적은 처음이야.

segments.text: Do you know why she's been so different this time, Pedra?
segments.speaker: Constantine
segments.translation: 페드라, 이번에 그녀가 왜 그렇게 달라졌는지 알고 있나?

segments.text: I didn't realize you had time to invite me to play table tennis.
segments.speaker: Committee Member Ⅱ
segments.translation: 탁구 치자고 초대할 시간이 있었다니 몰랐네요.

segments.text: Or ... are you actually here to lobby, Madam Z?
segments.speaker: Committee Member Ⅱ
segments.translation: 아니면... 혹시 로비를 하러 오신 건가요, Z 부인?

segments.text: Heh heh ... I'll say both, Katz.
segments.speaker: Z
segments.translation: 하하, 둘 다 맞습니다. 카츠.

segments.text: Back then when I was a student, I'd often invite my classmates to play ping-pong after we left the laboratory.
segments.speaker: Z
segments.translation: 학생 시절에는 실험실에서 나온 후 동기들과 탁구를 치곤 했지.

segments.text: A cold shower after getting soaked in sweat is a piece of memory I can't forget.
segments.speaker: Z
segments.translation: 땀에 흠뻑 젖은 뒤 찬물로 샤워하는 건 잊을 수 없는 추억이에요.

segments.text: Heh heh ... you remind me of the old days in the table tennis varsity.
segments.speaker: Committee Member Ⅱ
segments.translation: 위원회 위원 Ⅱ: 헤헤... 탁구부 시절이 생각나는군.

segments.text: You're the only one I can practice with here.
segments.speaker: Committee Member Ⅱ
segments.translation: 여기서는 너하고만 연습할 수 있어.

segments.text: Serve it, Madam Z.
segments.speaker: Committee Member Ⅱ
segments.translation: 내어주세요, Z 부인.

segments.text: Let's compete.
segments.speaker: Committee Member Ⅱ
segments.translation: 경쟁해보자.

segments.text: Hahaha ...! Backhand chop? Great, great.
segments.speaker: Committee Member Ⅱ
segments.translation: 하하하...! 백핸드 찹? 좋아, 아주 좋아.

segments.text: She nimbly picks up the white ball and bows.
segments.translation: 그녀는 재빨리 흰색 공을 주워 들고서 몸을 숙인다.

segments.text: Again. Ready to go!
segments.speaker: Committee Member Ⅱ
segments.translation: 다시. 준비됐어!

segments.text: Hey!
segments.speaker: Z
segments.translation: 얍!

segments.text: Nice shot!
segments.speaker: Committee Member Ⅱ
segments.translation: 좋은 공격이야!

segments.text: Madam Z strikes. The little ball flies over the net in an extremely low parabola, and goes into the unguarded corner of the table.
segments.translation: Z가 탁구채를 휘두르자 공이 아주 낮은 포물선을 그리며 네트 위를 뛰어넘었고, 아무도 없는 테이블 모서리에 부딪혔다.

segments.text: Katz turns her body to one side, striking the ball back confidently.
segments.translation: 카츠는 재빨리 몸을 옆으로 돌리더니 침착하게 되받아쳤다.

segments.text: We're planning to revise some articles in the draft.
segments.speaker: Z
segments.translation: 우리는 초안의 일부 조항을 수정할 생각이에요.

segments.text: Which articles?
segments.speaker: Committee Member Ⅱ
segments.translation: 어떤 조항들을?

segments.text: The articles about strengthening the control of registered arcanists.
segments.speaker: Z
segments.translation: 등록된 마도학자에 대한 통제를 강화하는 조항이요.

segments.text: You're right. We do need to improve the credibility of the Foundation in the outside world.
segments.speaker: Z
segments.translation: 맞습니다. 외부 세계에서 재단의 신뢰도를 높여야 하죠.

segments.text: Tell me more.
segments.speaker: Committee Member Ⅱ
segments.translation: 더 자세히 말해봐.

segments.text: The Timekeeper's power to discipline should be transferred back to the School of Discipline and the Foundation.
segments.speaker: Z
segments.translation: 타임키퍼의 징계권은 교관 학교와 재단으로 다시 이관되어야 합니다.

segments.text: The Foundation will conduct a unified risk assessment on arcanists.
segments.speaker: Z
segments.translation: 재단은 마도학자를 대상으로 통일된 위험 평가를 수행할 것입니다.

segments.text: To ensure this team is always under control.
segments.speaker: Z
segments.translation: 이 팀이 항상 통제하에 있도록 하기 위해서죠.

segments.text: But in fact it still belongs to the Timekeeper, right?
segments.speaker: Committee Member Ⅱ
segments.translation: 하지만 사실 그건 여전히 타임키퍼 소유 아닌가?

segments.text: That is our minimum requirement and it will not change.
segments.speaker: Z
segments.translation: 그 점이 우리의 핵심 요구사항이며, 변하지 않을 것입니다.

segments.text: Heh heh ...
segments.speaker: Committee Member Ⅱ
segments.translation: 헤헤헤...

segments.text: I didn't expect you to compromise.
segments.speaker: Committee Member Ⅱ
segments.translation: 네가 타협할 줄은 몰랐는데.

segments.text: It's not a compromise. It's a reasonable amendment to the draft.
segments.speaker: Z
segments.translation: 이건 양보가 아닙니다. 초안을 염두에 둔 합리적인 개선책인 거죠.

segments.text: Transferring the power of education and discipline to the Foundation will help lower the budget and reduce the pressure on Vertin.
segments.speaker: Z
segments.translation: 교육과 훈육 권한을 재단으로 이관하면 예산을 줄이고 버틴에게 가해지는 압박도 덜어줄 수 있을 거야.

segments.text: And you would even lobby an opponent, me, for this amendment.
segments.speaker: Committee Member Ⅱ
segments.translation: 그리고 당신은 이 수정안을 위해 반대파인 나에게까지 로비를 하려 하는군요.

segments.text: A reasonable appeal shouldn't be rejected just because it is raised by a different faction.
segments.speaker: Z
segments.translation: 합리적인 요구는 목소리를 낸 진영이 달라진다고 해서 퇴색되지 않아요.

segments.text: The Foundation needs solidarity, not contradiction.
segments.speaker: Z
segments.translation: 재단에 필요한 것은 단결과 연대이지, 대항과 투쟁이 아닙니다.

segments.text: If the draft is meant to pass, I will do whatever I can to make it meet most expectations.
segments.speaker: Z
segments.translation: 이 초안이 통과된다면, 전 대다수의 기대에 부응할 수 있도록 최선을 다할 것입니다.

segments.text: Just like this ping-pong game …
segments.speaker: Z
segments.translation: 이 탁구 시합처럼...

segments.text: Friendship first, competition second.
segments.speaker: Z
segments.translation: 친선 도모가 첫 번째, 대결이 두 번째이죠.

segments.text: Legislation shall serve the people.
segments.speaker: Z
segments.translation: 입법은 국민을 위해 존재해야 합니다.

segments.text: You have my vote, Madam Z.
segments.speaker: Committee Member Ⅱ
segments.translation: 제트 여사, 저는 찬성표를 던지겠습니다.

segments.text: Heh heh ... A vote is not the only thing I need, Katz.
segments.speaker: Z
segments.translation: 하하... 제게 필요한 건 겨우 표 하나뿐만이 아니에요, 카츠.

segments.text: Days later
segments.translation: 며칠 후

segments.text: Constantine.
segments.speaker: Chairwoman
segments.translation: 콘스탄틴.

segments.text: Constantine, sitting behind the rostrum, looks up. She takes off her reading glasses and closes the book in her hand.
segments.translation: 연단 뒤에 앉아 있던 콘스탄틴이 고개를 들었다. 그녀는 독서용 안경을 벗고 손에 들고 있던 책을 덮었다.

segments.text: Has the voting started?
segments.speaker: Constantine
segments.translation: 투표가 시작됐나?

segments.text: You see, here is the number of votes I have estimated. The pro-drafts will lose by five votes to their opponent.
segments.speaker: Constantine
segments.translation: 보다시피, 여기 내가 추산한 표수가 있어. 찬성파는 반대파에게 5표 차이로 질 거야.

segments.text: Don't forget our bet.
segments.speaker: Constantine
segments.translation: 우리 내기 잊지 마.

segments.text: The one who loses will pay for the new stamps.
segments.speaker: Constantine
segments.translation: 진 사람이 새 우표값을 내는 거야.

segments.text: The final vote is not today ... I'm afraid.
segments.speaker: Chairwoman
segments.translation: 최종 투표는... 오늘이 아닙니다.

segments.text: She has a complicated look on her face.
segments.translation: 그녀의 얼굴에 복잡한 표정이 떠올랐다.

segments.text: Z's speech is still ongoing.
segments.speaker: Chairwoman
segments.translation: Z의 연설이 아직 진행 중이야.

segments.text: She has just started the part on Article 3, Section 5 of the rules of procedure ...
segments.speaker: Chairwoman
segments.translation: 그녀는 방금 절차 규정 제3조 5항 부분을 시작했어...

segments.text: But the speech has already lasted seven hours.
segments.speaker: Chairwoman
segments.translation: 하지만 연설이 벌써 7시간이나 계속되고 있어요.

segments.text: Even some delegates have left.
segments.speaker: Chairwoman
segments.translation: 대표단 중 일부도 떠났군.

segments.text: What ...
segments.speaker: Constantine
segments.translation: 뭐야...

segments.text: She smiles, surprised.
segments.translation: 그녀는 놀란 듯 미소 지었다.

segments.text: A filibuster?
segments.speaker: Constantine
segments.translation: 의사진행방해?

segments.text: Yes, and Katz's speech will be right after that.
segments.speaker: Chairwoman
segments.translation: 맞아, 그리고 바로 그 다음에 카츠의 연설이 있을 거야.

segments.text: So I guess the final vote won't start until tomorrow.
segments.speaker: Chairwoman
segments.translation: 그럼 최종 투표는 내일까지는 시작되지 않을 것 같군요.

segments.text: That won't make a difference. Delaying the vote won't change the result.
segments.speaker: Chairwoman
segments.translation: 소용없어. 투표를 미룬다고 해서 결과가 바뀌지는 않아.

segments.text: Constantine sighs.
segments.translation: 콘스탄틴이 한숨을 내쉬었다.

segments.text: I didn't expect that she would be trying so hard.
segments.speaker: Constantine
segments.translation: 그녀가 그렇게까지 열심히 노력할 줄은 몰랐어.

segments.text: But for me, this is not necessarily bad news.
segments.speaker: Constantine
segments.translation: 하지만 나에게는 꼭 나쁜 소식만은 아니야.

segments.text: The filibuster will only have two outcomes.
segments.speaker: Constantine
segments.translation: 의사진행 방해는 두 가지 결과만 가져올 뿐이야.

segments.text: It is either one of the parties wins over two-thirds of support and gains victory, or both parties get stuck in a tug of war.
segments.speaker: Constantine
segments.translation: 한 쪽이 3분의 2 이상의 지지를 얻어 승리하거나, 아니면 양측이 줄다리기에 빠져 교착상태가 되거나 둘 중 하나야.

segments.text: If this tug of war doesn't end with a clear outcome, the Storm Reformation will end up completely dead and forbidden to be discussed within five years.
segments.speaker: Constantine
segments.translation: 이 줄다리기가 명확한 결과 없이 끝난다면, 폭풍우 개혁은 5년 안에 완전히 사장되어 논의조차 금기시될 거야.

segments.text: Are the stakes ... getting too high?
segments.speaker: Constantine
segments.translation: 판돈이... 너무 커지고 있는 건 아닐까?

segments.text: Someone trots over from the doorway. As he comes up to them, he bends over so that only Constantine can hear him.
segments.translation: 누군가가 입구에서부터 종종걸음으로 뛰어왔다. 그리고는 콘스탄틴에게만 들리도록 몸을 숙였다.

segments.text: Madam Vice President.
segments.speaker: Chief of Staff
segments.translation: 부통령님.

segments.text: Mr. President came back from the Pax House.
segments.speaker: Chief of Staff
segments.translation: 대통령님께서 팍스 하우스에서 돌아오셨습니다.

segments.text: I will go see him now.
segments.speaker: Constantine
segments.translation: 지금 그를 보러 가겠습니다.

segments.text: He is waiting for you in the office.
segments.speaker: Chief of Staff
segments.translation: 사무실에서 기다리고 계십니다.

segments.text: It has been over a year since they last met.
segments.translation: 그들이 마지막으로 만난 지 벌써 1년이 넘었다.

segments.text: Constantine quickly trots along the hallway.
segments.translation: 콘스탄틴은 복도를 종종걸음으로 지나갔다.

segments.text: The window is clear enough to give reflections. She stops and fixes her collar.
segments.translation: 창문에 그림자가 비쳤다. 그녀는 멈춰 서서 옷깃을 다듬었다.

segments.text: The door is left half open.
segments.translation: 문이 반쯤 열린 채로 남겨져 있다.

segments.text: Mr. President …
segments.speaker: Constantine
segments.translation: 대통령님…

segments.text: Good day to you, sir. May the peace be with us.
segments.speaker: Constantine
segments.translation: 안녕하세요. 우리에게 평화가 함께하길 바랍니다.

segments.text: May the peace be with us.
segments.speaker: President
segments.translation: 평화가 우리와 함께하기를.

segments.text: Are you feeling better these days?
segments.speaker: Constantine
segments.translation: 요즘 좀 어때? 괜찮아?

segments.text: I can still hang in for a few years. Thank you.
segments.speaker: President
segments.translation: 몇 년은 더 버틸 수 있습니다. 고맙습니다.

segments.text: Are they doing alright?
segments.speaker: Constantine
segments.translation: 걔들 괜찮나?

segments.text: Just as usual. Nothing to worry about.
segments.speaker: President
segments.translation: 평소와 다를 게 없어. 걱정할 건 없다고.

segments.text: He gives Constantine a small wave in the shadow.
segments.translation: 그는 그림자 속에서 콘스탄틴에게 작게 손을 흔들어 보였다.

segments.text: She walks up to him.
segments.translation: 그녀가 그에게 다가갔다.

segments.text: I'll stay in the Foundation these months.
segments.speaker: President
segments.translation: 앞으로 몇 달간은 재단에 머물 예정이야.

segments.text: The agenda is well arranged.
segments.speaker: President
segments.translation: 일정이 잘 짜여 있군.

segments.text: There is something more important that I must tell you in person.
segments.speaker: President
segments.translation: 직접 전해드려야 할 더 중요한 일이 있습니다.

segments.text: Constantine nods, and bends over to listen.
segments.translation: 콘스탄틴은 고개를 끄덕이며 몸을 숙였다.

segments.text: The shadow of the president casts on her.
segments.translation: 회장의 그림자가 그녀에게 드리웠다.

segments.text: The rusty, feeble words are difficult to catch, but the meaning of every word makes her eyes wide open out of shock.
segments.translation: 녹슬고 가냘픈 목소리는 거의 들리지 않을 정도였지만, 글자 하나하나가 가진 의미는 그녀의 눈을 충격으로 휘둥글게 만들었다.

segments.text: This, is their judgment?
segments.speaker: Constantine
segments.translation: 이것이, 그들의 심판이라는 건가?

segments.text: Yes.
segments.speaker: President
segments.translation: 그래.

segments.text: Then ... I have no objection to it.
segments.speaker: Constantine
segments.translation: 그렇다면... 나는 그것에 이의가 없다.

segments.text: She slowly resumes standing, then retreats for a few steps and almost falls on the floor.
segments.translation: 그녀는 천천히 몸을 일으키며 몇 발짝 뒷걸음질 쳤고, 하마터면 바닥에 넘어질 뻔했다.

segments.text: Hold tight, my friend.
segments.speaker: President
segments.translation: 꽉 잡아, 친구.

segments.text: She supports herself by the file cabinet.
segments.translation: 그녀는 옆에 있는 서류함을 손으로 짚었다.

segments.text: Excuse me.
segments.speaker: Constantine
segments.translation: 실례합니다.

segments.text: I have to admit I was surprised.
segments.speaker: Constantine
segments.translation: 솔직히 놀랐다고 인정해야겠군.

segments.text: Thank you for telling me this.
segments.speaker: Constantine
segments.translation: 이런 걸 알려줘서 고마워.

segments.text: As witness?
segments.speaker: Sonetto
segments.translation: 증인으로요?

segments.text: Yes. Your report means a lot to him.
segments.speaker: Z
segments.translation: 응. 자네의 보고서가 그자에겐 상당히 중요해서 말이야.

segments.text: I ... I can provide the report, but I have no experience in court hearings ...
segments.speaker: Sonetto
segments.translation: 그... 보고서는 제공해드릴 수 있지만, 법정 심문에 참석해본 적이 없어서요...

segments.text: If I say something wrong, will it affect the special prosecutor's decision?
segments.speaker: Sonetto
segments.translation: 제가 말을 잘못하면 검찰의 판결에 영향을 줄 수 있나요?

segments.text: That's an unexpected question. Madam Z's voice turns gentle and soft after a moment of speechlessness.
segments.translation: 예상치 못한 질문이었다. 잠시 말문이 막힌 뒤, Z의 목소리가 부드럽고 온화해졌다.

segments.text: Sonetto, testifying is not taking exams. The court doesn't need a skillful witness.
segments.speaker: Z
segments.translation: 증언은 테스트가 아니야, 소네트. 법정에 노련한 증인은 필요 없어.

segments.text: Just honestly tell them what you saw. Focus on the point and don't distort the facts.
segments.speaker: Z
segments.translation: 자네가 보고 들은 걸 정직하게 말하기만 하면 돼. 핵심에서 벗어나거나 사실을 왜곡하지 말고.

segments.text: The Supreme Court ... they value the sense of justice of the youth.
segments.speaker: Z
segments.translation: 최고재판소는... 젊은이들의 정의감을 중요하게 생각하지.

segments.text: Sense of justice ...
segments.speaker: Sonetto
segments.translation: 정의감이요...

segments.text: And that's a noble quality you have.
segments.speaker: Z
segments.translation: 자네는 그 귀한 자질을 갖추고 있고.

segments.text: I will do my best, Madam Z.
segments.speaker: Sonetto
segments.translation: 최선을 다해볼게요, Z 씨.

segments.text: Call the witness.
segments.speaker: Special Prosecutor
segments.translation: 증인을 호출하시오.

segments.text: Entangled by the crowd, Sonetto walks into the court.
segments.translation: 소네트가 사람들 무리에 휩쓸려 법정으로 들어왔다.

segments.text: In front of her, the special prosecutor has an almost godlike solemn look on her face.
segments.translation: 그녀 앞에 앉은 특별 검사의 표정은 거의 신과 같이 근엄했다.

segments.text: Greetings. May the peace be with us.
segments.speaker: Sonetto
segments.translation: 안녕하세요, 평화가 우리와 함께하길.

segments.text: May the peace be with us.
segments.speaker: Special Prosecutor
segments.translation: 평화가 우리와 함께하기를.

segments.text: Sonetto, as informed by the subpoena, you have been called forth by the accuser, Bernard Wilson, to testify as the witness in court. Could you specify the relationship between you and the accuser?
segments.speaker: Special Prosecutor
segments.translation: 소네트, 소환장에 명시된 바와 같이, 고발인 버나드 윌슨의 요청에 따라 법정에서 증인으로 증언하기 위해 출석하게 되었습니다. 당신과 고발인의 관계를 명시해 주시겠습니까?

segments.text: We did not know each other. I heard of him at work, but we rarely worked together.
segments.speaker: Sonetto
segments.translation: 저희는 모르는 사이입니다. 업무 수행 중에 이름을 들어본 적은 있지만, 만난 적은 없습니다.

segments.text: Then why did he call you?
segments.speaker: Special Prosecutor
segments.translation: 그럼 왜 당신을 불렀을까요?

segments.text: I was one of the parties involved in the 1929 "Storm" incident. I submitted a detailed report of that. He searched the database and found the report, so he made a request for access to my supervisor, Madam Z.
segments.speaker: Sonetto
segments.translation: 저는 1929년 폭풍우 사건의 당사자 중 한 사람으로서, 상세한 사건 보고서를 제출한 적 있습니다. 그분이 데이터베이스를 검색해서 보고서를 찾았고, 제 상사인 Z 씨에게 열람 신청서를 제출했습니다.

segments.text: Then, Madam Z asked if I would be willing to provide the report and attend court as witness.
segments.speaker: Sonetto
segments.translation: 그래서 Z 씨가 제게 보고서를 제출하고 법정 증인으로 설 의향이 있는지 물어보았습니다.

segments.text: Could you tell me the reason why you agreed to testify?
segments.speaker: Special Prosecutor
segments.translation: 증언에 동의한 이유를 말씀해 주시겠습니까?

segments.text: I ... My immediate supervisor is having a long-term treatment, and there are more time slots available on my schedule.
segments.speaker: Sonetto
segments.translation: 제... 제 직속상관이 현재 장기 치료를 받고 있어서 업무 일정이 많이 여유롭습니다.

segments.text: I am happy to be able to make a difference during the time, and defend the established facts.
segments.speaker: Sonetto
segments.translation: 저는 그동안 뭔가를 할 수 있다는 것과, 이미 알고 있는 사실에 대해 변호하는 것을 기쁘게 생각합니다.

segments.text: More importantly ...
segments.speaker: Sonetto
segments.translation: 더 중요한 건...

segments.text: Sonetto musters her courage and presents a box of files on the desk.
segments.translation: 소네트가 용기를 내어 책상 위에 서류 상자를 올려놓았다.

segments.text: I, personally, believe that there is still much room for improvement for the Foundation's office in Chicago in the United States.
segments.speaker: Sonetto
segments.translation: 제... 제 개인적인 생각이지만 재단의 미국 시카고 사무소에는 개선의 여지가 아직 많이 남아있다는 점입니다.

segments.text: The special prosecutor seems slightly surprised.
segments.translation: 검사는 약간 의아해했다.

segments.text: What is this? Ms. Sonetto.
segments.speaker: Special Prosecutor
segments.translation: 이게 뭐죠? 소네트 씨.

segments.text: This is a record of all my travels from the time I received the promotion order in the research center to go to the office in Chicago in the United States, to the time I went back to the headquarters of the Foundation when the "Storm" came.
segments.speaker: Sonetto
segments.translation: 이것은 제가 연구센터에서 미국 시카고 사무소로 가라는 승진 명령을 받은 때부터, 폭풍우가 왔을 때 재단 본부로 돌아간 때까지의 모든 여행 기록입니다.

segments.text: This is the field report and diary I wrote about the "Storm" in 1929.
segments.speaker: Sonetto
segments.translation: 이건 제가 쓴 1929년 폭풍우 사건의 현지 조사 보고서와 일기구요.

segments.text: What point do you make?
segments.speaker: Special Prosecutor
segments.translation: 무슨 요점을 말하고자 하는 건가?

segments.text: I would like to prove that the Foundation's office in Chicago in the United States violated the declaration "Fight for the Peace and Order of Mankind" and the rights of some humans and arcanists.
segments.speaker: Sonetto
segments.translation: 미국 시카고에 있는 재단 사무소가 인류의 평화와 질서를 위한 투쟁 선언문과 일부 인간 및 마도사들의 권리를 침해했다는 것을 증명하고 싶습니다.

segments.text: You are tarnishing our reputation!
segments.translation: 자네는 우리의 명예를 더럽히고 있어!

segments.text: Someone leaps to his feet on the other side of the table.
segments.translation: 회의 테이블의 반대편에서 누군가가 벌떡 일어났다.

segments.text: He is the assigned director of this constituency, the defendant of this court.
segments.translation: 그는 이 선거구의 지정 관리자이자, 이 법정의 피고인이다.

segments.text: I request a debate duel. I won't allow her to distort the truth like this.
segments.speaker: The Defendant
segments.translation: 토론 결투를 요청합니다. 저런 식으로 진실을 왜곡하는 것을 용납할 수 없어요.

segments.text: Mr. Seth, I haven't checked these files yet.
segments.speaker: Special Prosecutor
segments.translation: 세스 씨, 아직 이 파일들을 확인하지 못했습니다.

segments.text: Silence, please.
segments.speaker: Special Prosecutor
segments.translation: 조용히 해주세요.

segments.text: Your Honor, you can examine the files one by one while we're having the debate duel.
segments.speaker: The Defendant
segments.translation: 재판장님, 저희가 논쟁 결투를 하는 동안 서류들을 하나씩 검토해 보시기 바랍니다.

segments.text: I can't bear to see the long history of our office slandered in this way by a newcomer. I demand a duel with her.
segments.speaker: The Defendant
segments.translation: 신참이 우리 사무소의 오랜 역사를 이런 식으로 모독하는 걸 보고만 있을 수 없어. 그녀와 결투를 요구한다.

segments.text: Sonetto is an investigator with rich combat experience. There is no good dueling with her.
segments.speaker: Special Prosecutor
segments.translation: 소네트는 풍부한 전투 경험을 가진 조사원이야. 그녀와 결투하는 건 현명하지 않아.

segments.text: The special prosecutor turns to Sonetto.
segments.translation: 특별 검사가 소네트를 향해 몸을 돌렸다.

segments.text: Do you accept the debate duel?
segments.speaker: Special Prosecutor
segments.translation: 토론 결투를 받아들이겠나?

segments.text: I have no objection, madam.
segments.speaker: Sonetto
segments.translation: 이의 없습니다, 검사님.

segments.text: The defendant's neck has turned scarlet out of anger.
segments.translation: 피고인의 목이 분노로 인해 붉게 달아올랐다.

segments.text: The special prosecutor stands up and raises both of her arms.
segments.translation: 특별검사가 일어서서 양팔을 들어 올렸다.

segments.text: Please, to the stage, duelists.
segments.speaker: Special Prosecutor
segments.translation: 자, 결투자들이여, 무대로 나오시길.

segments.text: The debate during your duel will be faithfully recorded.
segments.speaker: Special Prosecutor
segments.translation: 당신의 결투 중 벌어질 논쟁은 충실히 기록될 것입니다.

segments.text: Three defeats in the debate of one side will end the duel.
segments.speaker: Special Prosecutor
segments.translation: 한쪽이 토론에서 세 번 패배하면 결투가 끝난다.

segments.text: You have the floor now.
segments.speaker: Special Prosecutor
segments.translation: 이제 당신이 말할 차례입니다.

segments.text: Schneider ... a friend we met in Chicago.
segments.speaker: Sonetto
segments.translation: 슈나이더는... 시카고에 있을 때 사귄 친구입니다.

segments.text: She once chose to join the Foundation under the pressure of both the "Storm" and Manus Vindictae.
segments.speaker: Sonetto
segments.translation: 그녀는 폭풍우와 재건의 손에서 양쪽으로 압박받다가 재단을 선택했어요.

segments.text: But instead of offering any solution or help, you just gave her a rejection letter.
segments.speaker: Sonetto
segments.translation: 하지만 당신들은 그 어떤 대답이나 도움도 주지 않았고, 그저 거절 편지 한 통만 보냈죠.

segments.text: I found this letter in her suit pocket.
segments.speaker: Sonetto
segments.translation: 이 편지는 제가 그녀의 수트 주머니에서 찾았습니다.

segments.text: It had a small line written on it, "Paupers f**k off."
segments.speaker: Sonetto
segments.translation: 위에 거지는 꺼져라.라고 작은 글씨로 쓰여 있죠.

segments.text: I-I had completely no idea what this was about ...
segments.speaker: The Defendant
segments.translation: 저-저는 이게 뭔지 전혀 몰랐어요...

segments.text: Not to mention the fact that no one at the office had ever heard of the "Storm" ... What help could they offer?
segments.speaker: The Defendant
segments.translation: 게다가 사무소의 그 누구도 폭풍우에 대해 들어본 적이 없다는 사실은 말할 것도 없고... 그들이 무슨 도움을 줄 수 있겠어?

segments.text: In this particular case, you should have reported to the headquarters or to the investigators out there, instead of doing nothing but leaving an insult.
segments.speaker: Sonetto
segments.translation: 이런 경우에는 본부나 현장의 조사원들에게 보고했어야 하는 거 아닌가요? 모독적인 말만 남겨두고 아무것도 하지 않는 대신 말이에요.

segments.text: I do not understand ... why there was such wording on it.
segments.speaker: Sonetto
segments.translation: 이해가 안 가네요... 위에 왜 이런 글귀가 쓰인 건지 말입니다.

segments.text: Was it because she did not pay enough "shelter fee" to qualify for sheltering?
segments.speaker: Sonetto
segments.translation: 보호료를 제대로 지불하지 않으면 피난 신청할 자격이 없다는 뜻인가요?

segments.text: Or was it because the wand she used was transformed by arcanum, which made you think she was an arcanist?
segments.speaker: Sonetto
segments.translation: 그게 아니라면 개조된 완드를 사용하는 슈나이더를 마도학자로 오해했기 때문입니까?

segments.text: Does not the Declaration of Peace say "Everyone, strong or weak, rich or poor, of any race, deserves a helping hand so that the existing peace and order shall be maintained"?
segments.speaker: Sonetto
segments.translation: 평화 선언문에 강하든 약하든, 부유하든 가난하든, 어떤 종족이든 상관없이 모든 이가 도움받을 자격이 있으며, 이를 통해 기존의 평화와 질서가 유지되어야 한다고 나와 있지 않나요?

segments.text: They were humans. If only they had made it to the headquarters sooner ... maybe … they …
segments.speaker: Sonetto
segments.translation: 그들은 인간이었습니다. 본부에 좀 더 일찍 올 수 있었다면... 어쩌면...

segments.text: In the particular circumstance at present, it's impossible for the headquarters to take in humans from all over the world.
segments.speaker: Special Prosecutor
segments.translation: 현재 상황으로는 본부에서 전 세계의 인간들을 모두 받아들이는 것은 불가능합니다.

segments.text: But you bring out a possibility, a possibility better than anything that happened.
segments.speaker: Special Prosecutor
segments.translation: 하지만 당신은 가능성을 보여주고 있어. 지금까지 일어난 그 어떤 일보다도 나은 가능성을 말이야.

segments.text: Thank you very much for your testimony, Ms. Sonetto.
segments.speaker: Special Prosecutor
segments.translation: 증언해 주셔서 대단히 감사합니다, 소네트 씨.

segments.text: And also for the debate, Mr. Seth.
segments.speaker: Special Prosecutor
segments.translation: 그리고 토론을 위해서도 말이야, 세스 씨.

segments.text: The special prosecutor and the jury get up, gathering the papers on the desk.
segments.translation: 특별 검사와 배심원단이 일어나 책상 위의 서류들을 정리했다.

segments.text: Sonetto's ears are gradually cooling off.
segments.translation: 소네트 귀의 열이 점차 가라앉았다.

segments.text: I seemed to be ... too emotional just now ...
segments.speaker: Sonetto
segments.translation: 방금... 너무 감정적이었던 것 같습니다...

segments.text: She passes the hallway, feeling completely lost.
segments.translation: 그녀는 완전히 길을 잃은 채로 복도를 지나갔다.

segments.text: She feels the court session is not over, and she is still in the middle of the storm.
segments.translation: 그녀는 법정 심리가 아직 끝나지 않았으며, 자신이 여전히 폭풍우 한가운데에 있다고 느꼈다.

segments.text: Ms. Sonetto.
segments.speaker: Special Prosecutor
segments.translation: 소네트 씨.

segments.text: The special prosecutor stops her from behind.
segments.translation: 특별 검사가 뒤에서 그녀를 불러 세웠다.

segments.text: You brought us a great debate.
segments.speaker: Special Prosecutor
segments.translation: 당신이 우리에게 큰 논쟁거리를 가져다주었군.

segments.text: In the bright daylight in the hallway, Sonetto finally takes a good look at the special prosecutor.
segments.translation: 복도에 밝은 햇살이 비치는 가운데, 소네트는 마침내 특별 검사관의 모습을 제대로 살펴보았다.

segments.text: This is quite an extraordinary face.
segments.translation: 예사롭지 않은 얼굴이었다.

segments.text: White, hard, and of a skin texture different from any creature's.
segments.translation: 뽀얗고 단단해서 다른 생물의 피부와는 조금 달라 보였다.

segments.text: Have you heard of the Supreme Court?
segments.speaker: Special Prosecutor
segments.translation: 대법원에 대해 들어본 적 있나?

segments.text: You should come when you are free.
segments.speaker: Special Prosecutor
segments.translation: 시간 날 때 오세요.

segments.text: I was told you have something important to share?
segments.speaker: Constantine
segments.translation: 중요한 얘기가 있다고 들었는데?

segments.text: Yes, the filibuster is about to end.
segments.speaker: Chairwoman
segments.translation: 그래, 의사진행방해가 곧 끝날 예정이야.

segments.text: Z told me they are going to end the speech and apply for the official vote at noon.
segments.speaker: Chairwoman
segments.translation: Z가 정오에 연설을 마치고 공식 투표를 신청할 예정이라고 하더군.

segments.text: If you are going to continue with the debate, don't forget to send your men.
segments.speaker: Chairwoman
segments.translation: 토론을 계속할 거라면, 부하들을 보내는 것도 잊지 마.

segments.text: Constantine doesn't reply. She glances at the delegates on their seats.
segments.translation: 콘스탄틴은 아무 대꾸도 하지 않았고, 자리에 앉은 대표자들을 눈으로 훑었다.

segments.text: Do you see Bernard over there?
segments.speaker: Constantine
segments.translation: 저기 베르나르드 보여?

segments.text: Yes.
segments.speaker: Chairwoman
segments.translation: 그래.

segments.text: Quite a lot of his men attended today.
segments.speaker: Chairwoman
segments.translation: 그의 부하들이 오늘 꽤 많이 참석했군.

segments.text: They have remained uncommitted to Storm Reformation so far. I thought they wouldn't bother to attend ...
segments.speaker: Chairwoman
segments.translation: 지금까지 폭풍우 개혁에 대해 명확한 입장을 보이지 않았거든. 참석하지도 않을 줄 알았는데...

segments.text: The opposition side doesn't need a dozen more votes to win, after all.
segments.speaker: Chairwoman
segments.translation: 어차피 반대측이 승리하려면 12표가 더 필요한 것도 아니니까.

segments.text: But the advocates of the draft do.
segments.speaker: Constantine
segments.translation: 하지만 징병제를 지지하는 자들은 그렇게 생각하지.

segments.text: The chairwoman casts an eye on her, perplexed.
segments.translation: 의장은 당황스러운 듯 그녀를 힐끗 쳐다봤다.

segments.text: Yet Constantine doesn't intend to explain.
segments.translation: 하지만 콘스탄틴은 설명할 생각이 없어 보였다.

segments.text: She looks weary.
segments.translation: 그녀는 지쳐 보였다.

segments.text: There will be a new draft given to you in two hours.
segments.speaker: Constantine
segments.translation: 2시간 후에 새로운 초안을 드리겠습니다.

segments.text: I brought together a revision group last night with some hired experts. We have adjusted some of the articles in the previous draft.
segments.speaker: Constantine
segments.translation: 어젯밤에 고용한 전문가들과 함께 수정 작업팀을 꾸렸어. 이전 초안의 몇 가지 조항들을 조정했지.

segments.text: I will need you to present it to everyone when the time comes.
segments.speaker: Constantine
segments.translation: 때가 되면 네가 모든 사람들에게 그것을 보여줘야 할 거야.

segments.text: What for?
segments.speaker: Chairwoman
segments.translation: 뭘 위해서?

segments.text: Is their draft going to be adopted?
segments.speaker: Chairwoman
segments.translation: 그들의 초안이 채택될 예정인가?

segments.text: The chairwoman looks ghastly. She can't help but ask again to confirm her suspicion.
segments.translation: 의장의 얼굴이 창백해졌다. 그녀는 자신의 의심을 확인하기 위해 다시 묻지 않을 수 없었다.

segments.text: The draft is going to be adopted, isn't it?
segments.speaker: Chairwoman
segments.translation: 초안이 채택될 예정이지?

segments.text: ... There are things that even I cannot manoeuvre.
segments.speaker: Constantine
segments.translation: ... 나조차 어쩔 수 없는 일들이 있어.

segments.text: All I can do is bring benefits to as many people as possible.
segments.speaker: Constantine
segments.translation: 내가 할 수 있는 건 가능한 한 많은 사람들에게 도움이 되는 것뿐이야.

segments.text: I have specifically made some amendments to the clearance to educate and discipline unregistered arcanists in section 3 on page 21, as well as the duties and obligations of the Timekeeper's special team in section 1 on page 40.
segments.speaker: Constantine
segments.translation: 21페이지 3항의 미등록 마도술사들에 대한 교육 및 징계 관련 허가 조항과 40페이지 1항의 타임키퍼 특수팀의 의무 및 책임에 관해 특별히 몇 가지 수정사항을 반영했습니다.

segments.text: Every arcanist assigned to the Timekeeper's department will be put through the Foundation's risk assessment and graded accordingly.
segments.speaker: Constantine
segments.translation: 타임키퍼 부서에 배정되는 모든 마도사는 재단의 위험도 평가를 거쳐 그에 따라 등급이 매겨질 것입니다.

segments.text: Ordinary arcanists only need to receive primary Artificial Somnambulism training. The more extraordinary ones will be sent to the School of Discipline for re-education.
segments.speaker: Constantine
segments.translation: 일반적인 마도술사들은 기초 인공 몽유병 훈련만 받으면 된다. 더 특별한 자들은 재교육을 위해 규율 학교로 보내질 것이다.

segments.text: Delegate Mark also submitted another edition which was quite similar to this one.
segments.speaker: Chairwoman
segments.translation: 마크 대표도 이것과 상당히 유사한 또 다른 판본을 제출했습니다.

segments.text: Is that so?
segments.speaker: Constantine
segments.translation: 그런가?

segments.text: She chuckles. It is a half-relaxed and half-bitter smile.
segments.translation: 그녀는 가볍게, 그리고 약간 씁쓸한 듯 웃었다.

segments.text: Heh heh, well ... very well.
segments.speaker: Constantine
segments.translation: 헤헤, 그럼... 좋아.

segments.text: I'm pleased we have reached a consensus even before we meet.
segments.speaker: Constantine
segments.translation: 만나기도 전에 합의점에 도달할 수 있어서 기쁘군.

segments.text: Here are more things we have revised.
segments.speaker: Constantine
segments.translation: 수정한 것들이 더 있어.

segments.text: Given their resistance to the "Storm," the Timekeeper's special team will take up more work related to Manus Vindictae.
segments.speaker: Constantine
segments.translation: 그들이 폭풍우에 저항력을 가지고 있는 만큼, 타임키퍼의 특수팀이 재건의 손과 관련된 업무를 더 많이 맡게 될 것이다.

segments.text: The Foundation will utilize their abilities.
segments.speaker: Constantine
segments.translation: 재단에서 그들의 능력을 활용할 거야.

segments.text: She sits down on her chair.
segments.translation: 그녀가 의자에 앉았다.

segments.text: We have also fine-tuned the details.
segments.speaker: Constantine
segments.translation: 세부 사항도 완벽하게 조정했습니다.

segments.text: They will be given more executive power, while the Foundation retains control over all things.
segments.speaker: Constantine
segments.translation: 그들에게는 더 많은 집행권이 주어지겠지만, 모든 것에 대한 통제권은 재단이 유지할 거야.

segments.text: Remember, we have to make everyone aware of these changes before the voting starts.
segments.speaker: Constantine
segments.translation: 기억해, 투표가 시작되기 전에 모든 사람들이 이런 변화들을 알 수 있도록 해야 해.

segments.text: We have to make sure THIS version of the proposal is the one that gets the final approval in the end.
segments.speaker: Constantine
segments.translation: 결국 최종 승인을 받는 건 바로 이 버전의 제안서가 되도록 해야 해.

segments.text: Understood.
segments.speaker: Chairwoman
segments.translation: 알겠습니다.

segments.text: The chairwoman looks up. Lights shed on her reading glasses and give out a bluish white color.
segments.translation: 의장이 고개를 들었다. 빛이 그녀의 돋보기에 비치며 푸르스름한 흰색을 발했다.

segments.text: Can't believe this is happening ... Heh ...
segments.speaker: Chairwoman
segments.translation: 이런 일이 일어날 줄이야... 하...

segments.text: The first revolution targeting arcanists in the past decades ...
segments.speaker: Chairwoman
segments.translation: 지난 수십 년간 마도술사들을 겨냥한 첫 번째 혁명...

segments.text: Don't forget my stamps for this quarter, Constantine.
segments.speaker: Chairwoman
segments.translation: 콘스탄틴, 이번 분기 내 도장 찍는 거 잊지 마.

segments.text: The right side of the hall is where the most eloquent people gather—the lecture area.
segments.translation: 회의장의 오른쪽엔 가장 격앙된 분위기의 연설 구역이 있다.

segments.text: Madam Z stands on the podium. After the long speech lasting for days, she feels herself physically struggling to go on.
segments.translation: Z가 변론대에 서 있었다. 며칠간 긴 연설을 해온 터라 체력이 거의 바닥났다.

segments.text: But her mind is getting clearer and clearer, more and more excited. Every cell in her body is ready to wake up at the very moment the voting starts.
segments.translation: 하지만 그녀의 정신은 점점 더 맑아지고, 점점 더 흥분되고 있었다. 투표가 시작되는 바로 그 순간, 그녀의 온몸 구석구석 모든 세포가 깨어날 준비를 마쳤다.

segments.text: She looks at the rostrum. Constantine is sitting next to the chairwoman calmly.
segments.translation: 그녀가 단상을 바라보자, 의장 옆에 침착하게 앉아있는 콘스탄틴이 눈에 들어왔다.

segments.text: That is a strange calmness.
segments.translation: 이상한 고요함이었다.

segments.text: So strange that she is almost certain that she is watching Constantine place a piece on the bottom-right corner of the board.
segments.translation: 콘스탄틴이 바둑판 우측 하단 모서리에 바둑돌을 놓는 모습을 지켜보고 있다는 확신이 들 정도로 기묘한 상황이었다.

segments.text: Am I so tired that my eyes are failing me?
segments.speaker: Z
segments.translation: 너무 피곤해서 헛것이 다 보이네.

segments.text: No. It's not the time to relax.
segments.speaker: Z
segments.translation: 아니지, 아직 긴장을 풀 때가 아니야.

segments.text: Just two more hours. Hang in there. It will end soon …
segments.speaker: Z
segments.translation: 마지막으로 두 시간만 더 버티자. 곧 끝날 거야...

segments.text: Ah ...
segments.speaker: Regulus

segments.text: Roast leg of lamb ... Wellington steak ...
segments.speaker: Regulus
segments.translation: 양다리 구이... 비프웰링턴...

segments.text: Turkish kebab ...
segments.speaker: Regulus
segments.translation: 도네르 케밥...

segments.text: Ah ... I want meat ...
segments.speaker: Regulus
segments.translation: 아... 고기 먹고 싶다...

segments.text: Hmm? Are you hungry?
segments.speaker: Sotheby
segments.translation: 음? 배고파?

segments.text: Worry not, worry not. The leaves of the potatoes we planted have turned yellow!
segments.speaker: Sotheby
segments.translation: 걱정 마, 걱정 마! 우리가 심은 감자 잎이 노랗게 변했어!

segments.text: Ms. Druvis said this is the harvest time! Let's dig them out and make shepherd's pie!
segments.speaker: Sotheby
segments.translation: 드루비스 선생님이 수확철이라고 하셨어요! 캐내서 셰퍼드 파이를 만들어요!

segments.text: Potato? Vegetable? ... No. I don't want them anymore.
segments.speaker: Regulus
segments.translation: 감자? 채소?... 아냐, 더 이상 그런 건 먹기 싫어.

segments.text: I've been eating healthy salads for a month!
segments.speaker: Regulus
segments.translation: 벌써 한 달째 건강한 샐러드만 먹고 있다고!

segments.text: I want meat ...
segments.speaker: Regulus
segments.translation: 아... 고기 먹고 싶다...

segments.text: I want rich, juicy, meaty, sinewy, savory, sizzling meat!!
segments.speaker: Regulus
segments.translation: 육즙이 풍부하고 두툼한 육질이 쫄깃쫄깃 씹히는 고기를 실컷 먹고 싶다고...!!

segments.text: Regulus suddenly springs to her feet.
segments.translation: 레굴루스가 갑자기 펄쩍 뛰었다.

segments.text: Wait! ... It smells so good. That's meat!
segments.speaker: Regulus
segments.translation: 잠깐!... 좋은 냄새야, 맛있는 고기 냄새가 나는데!

segments.text: Where's that smell coming from?
segments.speaker: Regulus
segments.translation: 이건 어디에서 흘러들어온 냄새지?

segments.text: Hmm ... I do smell something good as well ...
segments.speaker: Sotheby
segments.translation: 음... 나도 뭔가 좋은 냄새가 나는 것 같은데...

segments.text: Sotheby stands on tiptoe, seeking the source of the incredible smell.
segments.translation: 소더비는 발꿈치를 들어 그 놀라운 냄새의 근원지를 찾는다.

segments.text: I'll take a look!
segments.speaker: Regulus
segments.translation: 내가 한번 봐볼게!

segments.text: Regulus rubs her stomach, grabs her bag, and dashes out.
segments.translation: 레굴루스는 배를 문지르며 가방을 챙겨 밖으로 뛰쳐나간다.

segments.text: Wait, Regulus! The critters' lair is over there!
segments.speaker: Sotheby
segments.translation: 잠깐, 레굴루스! 그 녀석들 소굴은 저쪽이야!

segments.text: Critters?
segments.speaker: Regulus
segments.translation: 크리터?

segments.text: Haha, no worries! Critter is a type of meat! Roast it over fire and a square meal is here!
segments.speaker: Regulus
segments.translation: 하하, 걱정 마! 크리터는 고기의 한 종류야! 불에 구우면 든든한 한 끼 식사 완성이지!

segments.text: Ah, it smells so good ...
segments.speaker: Regulus
segments.translation: 아, 냄새 좋다...

segments.text: It's over here ...
segments.speaker: Regulus
segments.translation: 이쪽이군...

segments.text: She has gone.
segments.translation: 그녀는 떠났다.

segments.text: Oh no, what can I do ...
segments.speaker: Sotheby
segments.translation: 아, 안 돼... 어떻게 하지...

segments.text: Father said some critters could cause hallucination and diarrhea if eaten ...!
segments.speaker: Sotheby
segments.translation: 아버지가 말씀하시길 어떤 벌레들은 먹으면 환각이나 설사를 일으킬 수 있다고...!

segments.text: What's going on, Ms. Sotheby? Why are you here walking around alone?
segments.speaker: APPLe
segments.translation: 소더비 씨, 무슨 일 있나요? 왜 혼자서 여길 맴돌고 계시는 거죠?

segments.text: APPLe floats in the air and looks around them.
segments.translation: APPLe이 공중에 떠다니며 사방을 내려다본다.

segments.text: Em, where is Captain?
segments.speaker: APPLe
segments.translation: 음, 캡틴은 어디 계신가요?

segments.text: Oh, good to see you here!
segments.speaker: Sotheby
segments.translation: 오, 여기서 만나니 반가워요!

segments.text: Regulus said she smelled meat ... and went straight to the forest to catch critters!
segments.speaker: Sotheby
segments.translation: 레굴루스가 고기 냄새가 난다고 하더니... 바로 숲으로 달려가서 동물들을 잡으러 갔어!

segments.text: ... Waffle!
segments.speaker: APPLe

segments.text: It has been too long since we last had Dr. Papper. Does Captain finally start to have a senior moment?
segments.speaker: APPLe
segments.translation: 닥터 페퍼를 마신 지 너무 오래됐어요. 캡틴이 드디어 건망증이 생기기 시작한 건가요?

segments.text: Let's hurry over and take a look.
segments.speaker: Druvis Ⅲ
segments.translation: 서둘러서 가서 확인해보자.

segments.text: The smell of food is unusual. It's verdant over there. There may well be other dangers lurking somewhere.
segments.speaker: Druvis Ⅲ
segments.translation: 음식 냄새가 이상해. 저쪽은 푸르름이 가득하고... 어딘가에 다른 위험이 숨어있을지도 몰라.

segments.text: Regulus's figure appears among the trees.
segments.translation: 나무들 사이로 레굴루스의 모습이 나타났다.

segments.text: The aroma of food has also become more intense.
segments.translation: 음식 냄새 역시 점점 진해졌다.

segments.text: This is weird. Where on earth does the smell come from?
segments.speaker: Sotheby
segments.translation: 이상해. 도대체 이 냄새가 어디서 나는 거야?

segments.text: Regulus is also looking for the answer to the same question.
segments.translation: 레굴루스 역시 같은 질문에 대한 답을 찾고 있다.

segments.text: She looks down, scrabbling in the weeds. As she goes through them, the weeds unexpectedly shake, out of which springs up a black shadow.
segments.translation: 그녀가 고개를 숙이고 잡초 사이를 뒤적거렸다. 잡초를 헤치자 예상치 못하게 풀들이 흔들리더니, 그 사이에서 검은 그림자가 튀어나왔다.

segments.text: Whoa!
segments.speaker: Regulus

segments.text: Blimey, it's a Carbuncle! Regulus, it's not edible!
segments.speaker: Sotheby
segments.translation: 어머, 카벙클이야! 레굴루스, 그거 먹는 거 아니야!

segments.text: There comes another one.
segments.translation: 이어서 또 한 마리가 달려들었다.

segments.text: One after another, until Regulus has an armful of angry Carbuncles.
segments.translation: 하나둘 계속해서 달려들었고, 결국 레굴루스의 품은 성난 카벙클 떼로 가득해졌다.

segments.text: That's the lair of Carbuncles. They've been stirred up!
segments.speaker: Druvis Ⅲ
segments.translation: 저곳은 카벙클들의 소굴이야. 녀석들이 흥분한 모양이군!

segments.text: Whoa ... a bumper harvest of critters ...
segments.speaker: Regulus
segments.translation: 으악... 크리터 풍년이네...

segments.text: Come and help!
segments.speaker: Regulus
segments.translation: 어서 와서 도와줘!

segments.text: Hold on, Captain! We're coming!
segments.speaker: APPLe
segments.translation: 캡틴, 버티세요! 우리가 갑니다!

segments.text: Oooh ... Are they really all inedible?
segments.speaker: Regulus
segments.translation: 으으... 얘넨 정말 다 먹을 수 없는 거야?

segments.text: I did smell the sizzling meat ...
segments.speaker: Regulus
segments.translation: 분명히 지글지글 구워지는 고기 냄새가 났는데...

segments.text: It's somewhere around here, right around ...
segments.speaker: Regulus
segments.translation: 이 근처 어딘가에 있을 텐데, 바로 이 근처...

segments.text: Oh, hi.
segments.speaker: Lilya
segments.translation: 아, 안녕.

segments.text: Whoaaaa—!
segments.speaker: Regulus

segments.text: Who are you?!
segments.speaker: Regulus
segments.translation: 넌 누구냐?!

segments.text: An athletic figure shows up from behind the bushes.
segments.translation: 덤불 뒤에서 건장한 인물이 나타났다.

segments.text: Lilya?
segments.speaker: Druvis Ⅲ
segments.translation: 릴리야?

segments.text: What are you doing here ...
segments.speaker: Druvis Ⅲ
segments.translation: 여기서 뭘 하고 있는 거야...

segments.text: Lilya throws her bag at their feet ...
segments.translation: 릴리아가 가방을 그들의 발밑에 던졌다...

segments.text: A roasted leg of lamb, wrapped in tinfoil, falls out of her bag.
segments.translation: 은박지에 싸인 양다리 구이가 그녀의 가방에서 떨어져 나온다.

segments.text: I got you something good.
segments.speaker: Lilya
segments.translation: 좋은 걸 가져왔어.

segments.text: Roasted pork knuckle, farmers sausage, black forest ham, some unknown drinks, leba bread, leba bread, and leba bread.
segments.translation: 구운 돼지 족발, 농가 소시지, 흑림 햄, 정체불명의 음료수, 레바 빵, 레바 빵, 그리고 레바 빵.

segments.text: Whoa—!
segments.speaker: Regulus

segments.text: Regulus pulls out the lamb as quickly as a flash and devours the meat.
segments.translation: 레굴루스가 재빨리 양다리 구이를 꺼내더니 고기를 게걸스럽게 먹어치웠다.

segments.text: Ah! Lamb! It tastes so good ... sooo gooood! I barely know what grease is supposed to taste like oooooooh ...
segments.speaker: Regulus
segments.translation: 앗! 양다리다! 맛이... 끝내줘... 너무 맛있어! 지방 본연의 맛이 어떤 건지 까먹을 뻔했다고, 으아아아...

segments.text: Huh? It is me you should thank, the goddess of victory who soon brings you freedom.
segments.speaker: Lilya
segments.translation: 응? 고마워해야 할 사람은 바로 나야. 곧 너에게 자유를 가져다줄 승리의 여신 말이지.

segments.text: Bring us freedom soon? May I ask ... how should I interpret your words?
segments.speaker: Druvis Ⅲ
segments.translation: 곧 우리에게 자유를 가져다준다고? 여쭤봐도 될까요... 그 말씀을 어떻게 해석해야 할지요?

segments.text: Heh heh.
segments.speaker: Lilya
segments.translation: 헤헤.

segments.text: Lilya sits down on the ground.
segments.translation: 릴리아는 땅바닥에 털썩 주저앉았다.

segments.text: She opens one of the cans and pours the drink into her mouth.
segments.translation: 그녀는 캔 하나를 따서 음료를 입으로 쭉 들이켠다.

segments.text: You want some?
segments.speaker: Lilya
segments.translation: 좀 줄까?

segments.text: Druvis takes the drink from her and takes a sip.
segments.translation: 드루비스는 건네받아 한 모금 맛보았다.

segments.text: Thank you so much for coming alone and providing us with supplies, Lilya ...
segments.speaker: Druvis Ⅲ
segments.translation: 혼자 와서 보급품까지 가져다준 릴리야에게 정말 고마워...

segments.text: However, please tell us why you are here.
segments.speaker: Druvis Ⅲ
segments.translation: 하지만 여기에 온 이유를 말씀해 주세요.

segments.text: ... Did Madam Z send you?
segments.speaker: Druvis Ⅲ
segments.translation: ... Z 부인이 당신을 보낸 건가요?

segments.text: Lilya shakes her head. She gives out four fingers.
segments.translation: 릴리아가 고개를 젓더니 네 손가락을 내밀었다.

segments.text: Already been four and a half weeks. Right?
segments.speaker: Lilya
segments.translation: 벌써 4주 반이 지났네. 맞지?

segments.text: This is not the first time I visit you guys here.
segments.speaker: Lilya
segments.translation: 여기 너희들한테 오는 게 처음은 아니야.

segments.text: The one hiding in the shadow last time ... It's you?
segments.speaker: Druvis Ⅲ
segments.translation: 지난번에 그림자에 숨어있던 자... 너냐?

segments.text: I wonder how much longer you can hold on for Vertin.
segments.speaker: Lilya
segments.translation: 버틴을 위해 얼마나 더 버틸 수 있을지 궁금하네.

segments.text: You see, saying is one thing, fighting is another.
segments.speaker: Lilya
segments.translation: 보다시피, 말하는 것과 싸우는 것은 별개야.

segments.text: I've seen many deserters. Way too many.
segments.speaker: Lilya
segments.translation: 탈영병들을 너무 많이 봤어. 정말 너무 많이.

segments.text: Crying out loud, peeing their pants, drooling all over on their rabbit foot ...
segments.speaker: Lilya
segments.translation: 큰 소리로 울어대고, 바지에 오줌 싸고, 토끼발에 침 질질 흘리고...

segments.text: But you guys are different.
segments.speaker: Lilya
segments.translation: 하지만 너희들은 달라.

segments.text: You actually did it. You conquered places in the Foundation, defended your own places, and put pressure on those in white till this day, the last day in this four weeks and a half.
segments.speaker: Lilya
segments.translation: 정말 해냈군. 재단 내 거점들을 점령하고, 자신들의 영역을 지켜냈으며, 4주 반이라는 시간 동안 오늘 마지막 날까지 그 하얀 옷들에게 압박을 가했어.

segments.text: That's the iron will I appreciate.
segments.speaker: Lilya
segments.translation: 그런 강철 같은 의지, 마음에 들어.

segments.text: And if I didn't come today, would you eat your boots tomorrow?
segments.speaker: Lilya
segments.translation: 그리고 내가 오늘 오지 않았다면, 너 내일 신발이라도 삶아 먹을 거였어?

segments.text: Of course not. We still have potatoes. Almost ripe.
segments.speaker: Regulus
segments.translation: 당연히 아니지, 우리한텐 아직 감자가 있어. 곧 수확할 거야.

segments.text: And carrots!
segments.speaker: Sotheby
segments.translation: 그리고 당근도!

segments.text: Hahahahaha!
segments.speaker: Lilya
segments.translation: 하하하하하!

segments.text: Thank you for your kindness, Ms. Lilya. May I take it that you are coming to bring us the good news?
segments.speaker: Druvis Ⅲ
segments.translation: 친절하게 대해주셔서 감사합니다, 릴리야 씨. 좋은 소식을 전하러 오신 건가요?

segments.text: Is there a final result for Madam Z's draft?
segments.speaker: Druvis Ⅲ
segments.translation: Z 부인의 초안에 대한 최종 결과가 나왔나요?

segments.text: So far as I know, Madam Z hasn't given up yet.
segments.speaker: Lilya
segments.translation: 내가 아는 한, Z 부인은 아직 포기하지 않으셨어.

segments.text: Just like you, when she gets serious, she looks like a fierce doe.
segments.speaker: Lilya
segments.translation: 너처럼 그 애도 진지해지면 사나운 암사슴 같아 보여.

segments.text: But I already lost my patience.
segments.speaker: Lilya
segments.translation: 하지만 난 이미 참을성을 잃었어.

segments.text: Tons of "processes" need to be done before it can be performed, even if the draft is passed at the final vote.
segments.speaker: Lilya
segments.translation: 최종 표결에서 통과되더라도, 실제로 시행되기까지는 수많은 절차들을 거쳐야 해.

segments.text: As long as Vertin is still on that bed in the ward, you are just an isolated island.
segments.speaker: Lilya
segments.translation: 버틴이 아직 병동 침대에 누워 있는 한, 넌 그냥 고립된 섬일 뿐이야.

segments.text: Everyone can step on you.
segments.speaker: Lilya
segments.translation: 모든 사람이 너를 깔볼 수 있어.

segments.text: Lilya stands up and pats off the dust on her carelessly.
segments.translation: 릴리아가 몸을 일으키더니 아무렇지 않게 엉덩이 쪽을 털어냈다.

segments.text: "Take care of them for me when necessary."
segments.speaker: Lilya
segments.translation: 필요할 때 그들을 잘 부탁해.

segments.text: That's what Vertin said when she gave me the vodka.
segments.speaker: Lilya
segments.translation: 버틴이 보드카를 건네주면서 한 말이야.

segments.text: It's time to deliver on my promise.
segments.speaker: Lilya
segments.translation: 약속을 지킬 시간이야.

segments.text: Are you going to do something dangerous?
segments.speaker: Druvis Ⅲ
segments.translation: 위험한 일을 하려는 거야?

segments.text: A thing that is worth the risk.
segments.speaker: Lilya
segments.translation: 위험을 감수할 만한 가치가 있는 일이야.

segments.text: I've been waiting for this moment for so long.
segments.speaker: Lilya
segments.translation: 이 순간을 정말 오랫동안 기다려왔어.

segments.text: Someone needs to wake up from the dream.
segments.speaker: Lilya
segments.translation: 누군가는 꿈에서 깨어나야 해.

segments.text: Final round of the vote.
segments.speaker: Chairwoman
segments.translation: 투표 최종 라운드입니다.

segments.text: Voters, please hurry up.
segments.speaker: Chairwoman
segments.translation: 유권자 여러분, 서둘러 주세요.

segments.text: One minute to go.
segments.speaker: Chairwoman
segments.translation: 1분 남았다.

segments.text: Please be responsible to your votes in every round.
segments.speaker: Chairwoman
segments.translation: 매 라운드마다 여러분의 투표에 책임을 져주시기 바랍니다.

segments.text: Vote as soon as possible.
segments.speaker: Chairwoman
segments.translation: 가능한 한 빨리 투표하도록.

segments.text: The draft-avocates have more votes now, but they still need more than that to meet the supermajoritarian requirement.
segments.speaker: Debate Moderator
segments.translation: 징병 찬성파가 지금 더 많은 표를 얻었지만, 절대다수 요건을 충족하려면 아직 더 많은 표가 필요합니다.

segments.text: What ...!
segments.speaker: Mesmer Jr.

segments.text: Please vote now.
segments.speaker: Chairwoman
segments.translation: 이제 투표해 주십시오.

segments.text: Thirty seconds to go.
segments.speaker: Chairwoman
segments.translation: 30초 남았다.

segments.text: Final countdown.
segments.speaker: Chairwoman
segments.translation: 최종 카운트다운.

segments.text: Ten seconds to go.
segments.speaker: Chairwoman
segments.translation: 10초 남았다.

segments.text: This will be your last chance to vote. Please hurry up!
segments.speaker: Chairwoman
segments.translation: 이번이 투표할 마지막 기회입니다. 서둘러 주세요!

segments.text: Voting closed.
segments.speaker: Chairwoman
segments.translation: 투표를 마감합니다.

segments.text: Storm Reformation: Manpower and Discipline passed.
segments.speaker: Chairwoman
segments.translation: 인력 및 규율 통과.

segments.text: Bucket list, one less!
segments.speaker: Lilya
segments.translation: 버킷리스트, 하나 완료!

segments.text: The glass is not as hard as I thought.
segments.speaker: Lilya
segments.translation: 유리가 생각보다 단단하지 않네.

segments.text: Hey, time to wake up, Vertin.
segments.speaker: Lilya
segments.translation: 버틴, 일어날 시간이야.

segments.text: What's that sound? What's going on?!
segments.speaker: Senior Guard
segments.translation: 저 소리가 뭐지? 무슨 일이야?!

segments.text: Staff staying outside the ward rush into the room.
segments.translation: 원래 병실 밖을 지키고 서 있던 직원까지 전부 달려왔다.

segments.text: That was a quick reaction.
segments.speaker: Lilya
segments.translation: 반응이 빠르네.

segments.text: Oдин, две, три ... Well, relax. I'll keep the acceptable damage under eight.
segments.speaker: Lilya
segments.translation: Один, два, три... 뭐, 진정해. 허용 가능한 피해는 8 이하로 유지할게.

segments.text: What ... w-what is this ...
segments.speaker: Mesmer Jr.
segments.translation: 뭐... 뭐-뭐야 이게...

segments.text: Mesmer Jr. crouches next to the stool, rubbing her hands aimlessly.
segments.translation: 메스머 주니어는 걸상 옆에서 웅크린 자세로 손을 비비는 동작만 마구 반복했다.

segments.text: The staff are putting on well-designed helmets as they come in.
segments.translation: 밖에서 뛰어 들어온 직원이 정교한 헬멧을 머리에 썼다.

segments.text: Everyone, get your gear, formation one ...
segments.speaker: Senior Guard
segments.translation: 모두들, 장비 챙기고 1번 대형으로...

segments.text: Capture the intruder!
segments.speaker: Senior Guard
segments.translation: 침입자를 체포해라!

segments.text: Hahaha! Bring it on! Let me have my dear long-lost real fight!
segments.speaker: Lilya
segments.translation: 하하하! 덤벼라! 오랜만에 제대로 된 진짜 싸움을 해보자고!

segments.text: Lord of Dream (Matrix)
segments.speaker: FINAL BOSS
segments.translation: 꿈의 군주 (매트릭스)

segments.text: Heh ... heh heh ... hahaha ...
segments.speaker: Lilya
segments.translation: 헤... 헤헤... 하하하...

segments.text: Emergency! Room 1525 calling for backup!
segments.speaker: Senior Guard
segments.translation: 비상사태! 1525호실에서 지원 요청!

segments.text: Lilya whisks away his walkie-talkie.
segments.translation: 릴리아는 빗자루로 무전기를 날려버렸다.

segments.text: Hey, no backup! I need to strictly follow the damage control standard.
segments.speaker: Lilya
segments.translation: 야, 지원은 안 돼! 피해 통제 기준을 엄격히 따라야 한다고.

segments.text: L- ... Lilya ...?
segments.speaker: Vertin

segments.text: Finally awake?
segments.speaker: Lilya
segments.translation: 드디어 깨어났네?

segments.text: Nice, time for us to leave.
segments.speaker: Lilya
segments.translation: 좋아, 이제 떠날 시간이야.

segments.text: Come here and sit on the broom ... yes, behind me ... Grab tight! Don't say I didn't warn you if you fall down and die!
segments.speaker: Lilya
segments.translation: 이리 와서 빗자루에 타... 그래, 내 뒤에... 꽉 잡아! 떨어져서 죽어도 내가 경고 안 했다고 하지 마!

segments.text: Urgh ...
segments.speaker: Vertin

segments.text: Neither the mind nor the body is responding to her calling.
segments.translation: 머리와 몸이 말을 듣지 않았다.

segments.text: No reaction can be given to what is happening.
segments.translation: 눈앞에 펼쳐진 광경에 반응할 수 없었다.

segments.text: She only knows to grab the handrail tightly.
segments.translation: 그녀는 손잡이를 꼭 잡아야 한다는 것만 알고 있을 뿐이다.

segments.text: The metal handrail feels cold and hard. This is the result of everyone's effort.
segments.translation: 금속 난간이 차갑고 단단하게 느껴진다. 이것은 모든 이들의 노력이 만들어낸 결과다.

segments.text: Alright, Red 38, let's go!
segments.speaker: Lilya
segments.translation: 좋아, 레드 38호, 가자!

segments.text: A strong shake.
segments.translation: 강하게 흔들렸다.

segments.text: Mesmer Jr., Mesmer Jr.! What are you doing?! They are running away! Go ... Get them!
segments.speaker: Senior Guard
segments.translation: 메즈머 주니어, 메즈머 주니어! 뭐 하고 있는 거야?! 놈들이 도망가고 있잖아! 가서... 잡아와!

segments.text: Save your whining for Constantine!
segments.speaker: Lilya
segments.translation: 불평은 콘스탄틴한테나 해!

segments.text: The broom rises into the air.
segments.translation: 빗자루가 공중으로 떠올랐다.

segments.text: It doesn't waste a second to pause, flying towards the open windows.
segments.translation: 한 순간도 멈추지 않고 열려 있는 창문을 향해 날아갔다.

segments.text: The dazzling, glaring white light—so strange, but also so familiar.
segments.translation: 눈부시고, 찬란한 하얀 빛이... 낯설면서도 익숙하게 느껴졌다.

segments.text: Warm wind blows in through the window.
segments.translation: 따뜻한 바람이 창문을 통해 불어 들어온다.

segments.text: It's a cloudless, sunny day outside.
segments.translation: 창밖엔 맑은 하늘이 펼쳐져 있다.

segments.text: What good weather.
segments.speaker: Vertin
segments.translation: 날씨가 좋구나.

segments.text: My friends.
segments.speaker: Vertin
segments.translation: 친구들.

segments.text: How do you feel?
segments.speaker: Lilya
segments.translation: 기분이 어때?

segments.text: Getting used to the light?
segments.speaker: Lilya
segments.translation: 빛에 익숙해지고 있어?

segments.text: Hmm ...
segments.speaker: Vertin

segments.text: The wind feels ... so good ...
segments.speaker: Vertin
segments.translation: 바람에서... 정말 편안한 느낌이 드네...

segments.text: Haha, this is just an appetizer. I'll be gentle since you are just "discharged."
segments.speaker: Lilya
segments.translation: 하하, 이건 그냥 전채요리야. 네가 막 퇴원한 몸이니까 살살 해줄게.

segments.text: Are they alright?
segments.speaker: Vertin
segments.translation: 괜찮나요?

segments.text: Good as new.
segments.speaker: Lilya
segments.translation: 새것 같네.

segments.text: They stayed up all night, just to save you.
segments.speaker: Lilya
segments.translation: 그들은 밤을 새워가며 당신을 구하려고 했어요.

segments.text: Haha, I guess you are the only one who has slept tight.
segments.speaker: Lilya
segments.translation: 하하, 푹 잠든 건 너뿐인 것 같네.

segments.text: Haha ...
segments.speaker: Vertin
segments.translation: 하하...

segments.text: Madam Z, Druvis, Sonetto ...
segments.speaker: Lilya
segments.translation: Z 선생님, 드루비스, 소네트...

segments.text: From the bill, and the protesting, to countless debates, planning and ...
segments.speaker: Lilya
segments.translation: 법안부터 시작해서, 항의, 그리고 수없는 토론과 계획까지...

segments.text: Everyone is holding their umbrellas for you, Vertin.
segments.speaker: Lilya
segments.translation: 모두가 당신을 위해 우산을 들고 있어요, 버틴.

segments.text: The "Storm"...
segments.speaker: Lilya
segments.translation: 폭풍우...

segments.text: It will pass, one day.
segments.speaker: Lilya
segments.translation: 언젠가는 지나갈 거야.

segments.text: Thank you. Thank you all.
segments.speaker: Vertin
segments.translation: 고마워. 다들 고마워.

segments.text: Yes. Everything is going to be alright.
segments.speaker: Vertin
segments.translation: 그래. 모든 게 괜찮아질 거야.

segments.text: Enough flying. Time to head back.
segments.speaker: Lilya
segments.translation: 비행은 충분해. 이제 돌아갈 시간이야.

segments.text: What are we doing next?
segments.speaker: Vertin
segments.translation: 우린 이제 어떻게 해야 해?

segments.text: Hmm ... no idea. Meet your friends first.
segments.speaker: Lilya
segments.translation: 흠... 모르겠어. 친구들부터 만나봐.

segments.text: Fight with your comrade in arms, fear no danger ahead.
segments.speaker: Lilya
segments.translation: 전우와 함께 싸워, 앞에 닥친 위험 따위 두려워하지 마.

segments.text: Grab tight, I'm going to speed up.
segments.speaker: Lilya
segments.translation: 꽉 잡아, 속도 올릴 거야.

segments.text: The wind flows through them like waves.
segments.translation: 바람이 파도처럼 그들 사이로 흘러간다.

segments.text: Charge! The great Red 38!
segments.speaker: Lilya
segments.translation: 돌격! 위대한 레드 38호!

segments.text: Long live Su-01ве!
segments.speaker: Lilya
segments.translation: Su-01ве 만세!

segments.text: How are you feeling? Better now?
segments.speaker: Druvis Ⅲ
segments.translation: 기분이 어때? 이제 좀 나아졌어?

segments.text: Here's water! Captain, sip, please. Don't put too much pressure on your esophagus.
segments.speaker: APPLe
segments.translation: 여기 물이요! 캡틴, 천천히 마셔요, 식도에 부담을 너무 주면 안 됩니다.

segments.text: Ah ...
segments.speaker: Regulus

segments.text: I'm ... I'm alive ... Ah ...
segments.speaker: Regulus
segments.translation: 살, 살았다... 아...

segments.text: Oooh, I thought I wouldn't be able to see the sun tomorrow or see Vertin discharged!
segments.speaker: Regulus
segments.translation: 흑흑, 내일 해가 뜨는 것도 못 보고, 버틴이 퇴원하는 것도 못 볼 줄 알았어!

segments.text: Who's talking?
segments.speaker: Regulus
segments.translation: 누가 말한 거야?

segments.text: Is it because they have been apart for too long?
segments.translation: 너무 오래 떨어져 있었던 탓일까?

segments.text: Or is this an illusion generated by their longingness?
segments.translation: 아니면 너무 그리웠던 나머지 환각이 보이는 건가?

segments.text: They turn around in slow motion, straining their eyes.
segments.translation: 모두가 영화의 슬로 모션처럼 돌아서더니 두 눈이 휘둥그레졌다.

segments.text: Vertin!!!
segments.speaker: Regulus
segments.translation: 버틴!!!

segments.text: You're back!
segments.speaker: Regulus
segments.translation: 돌아왔구나!

segments.text: Because Lilya—
segments.speaker: Regulus
segments.translation: 그거야 릴리아가...

segments.text: Wait, whose voice was that ...
segments.speaker: Regulus
segments.translation: 잠깐, 지금 목소리는 누구...

segments.text: Is it ...
segments.speaker: Regulus
segments.translation: 혹시...

segments.text: Mixed feelings turn into tears running out of her eyes. Is it out of shock, or ecstasy?
segments.translation: 복잡한 감정이 눈물이 되어 그녀의 눈에서 흘러내렸다. 충격 때문일까, 아니면 황홀감 때문일까?

segments.text: So many struggling days and nights.
segments.translation: 힘겨워했던 무수한 낮과 밤이었다.

segments.text: This is the finish line of desperation. Ahead of them, hopes await.
segments.translation: 절망의 결승선이다. 그들 앞에는 희망이 기다리고 있다.

segments.text: Vertin! You silly git!
segments.speaker: Regulus
segments.translation: 버틴! 너 이 자식!

segments.text: Now you come back!
segments.speaker: Regulus
segments.translation: 이제야 돌아왔구나!

segments.text: Vertin!
segments.speaker: APPLe
segments.translation: 버틴!

segments.text: Vertin!!
segments.speaker: Druvis Ⅲ
segments.translation: 버틴!!

segments.text: Whoa ... *sobbing* ...
segments.speaker: Regulus
segments.translation: 으앙... 엉엉엉...

segments.text: Are you feeling okay? There was a lot of equipment connected to you ...
segments.speaker: Druvis Ⅲ
segments.translation: 괜찮아? 너한테 연결된 장비가 너무 많았는데...

segments.text: Do you feel any discomfort?
segments.speaker: Druvis Ⅲ
segments.translation: 불편한 곳은 없나?

segments.text: Do you need any nutritional supplements, Ms. Vertin? We have a lot of healthy, fresh salads here ...
segments.speaker: APPLe
segments.translation: 영양 보충제가 필요하신가요, 버틴 씨? 여기 건강하고 신선한 샐러드가 많이 있는데요...

segments.text: Where did you come back from? What are all these white pigeons doing after you?
segments.speaker: Sotheby
segments.translation: 어디서 돌아온 거야? 이 하얀 비둘기들이 왜 다 너를 따라다니는 거지?

segments.text: You seem to have gained weight ... No no, lost weight? Um, no ...
segments.speaker: Sotheby
segments.translation: 살이 좀 찐 것 같은데... 아니 아니, 빠진 건가? 음, 아니야...

segments.text: I'm fine. Fit as a fiddle.
segments.speaker: Vertin
segments.translation: 난 괜찮아. 아주 건강해.

segments.text: Just a bit of headache, nothing else.
segments.speaker: Vertin
segments.translation: 그냥 머리만 좀 아픈 것뿐이야.

segments.text: It's good to see you again.
segments.speaker: Vertin
segments.translation: 다시 만나서 좋다.

segments.text: Thank you for being here ... being around me.
segments.speaker: Vertin
segments.translation: 아직 이곳에 있어 줘서... 내 곁에 있어 줘서 고마워.

segments.text: Regulus wipes her face on the coat in front of her.
segments.translation: 레굴루스는 바로 앞의 옷소매에다 얼굴을 비빈다.

segments.text: ... Of course!
segments.speaker: Regulus
segments.translation: ...당연하지!

segments.text: Of course we ... we're waiting for you!
segments.speaker: Regulus
segments.translation: 우, 우리가 널 기다리는 건 당연한 거잖아!

segments.text: You're the only ... friend we have in this world!
segments.speaker: Regulus
